title: extracting CE font for freehand MX using FontLab 4
content:
hi all,

this may be an old topic, but I’ll ask the question anyway:

is there a way to create a special CE font to get freehand MX to display polish special characters? I’m using fontlab 4, but am a newbie with this (awfully mighty) program.

or: does anyone have the “Haettenschweiler” as CE version?

lost in glyphs & codes  
eva

 [‹ PowerPoint: Bug or Easter egg?](http://web.archive.org/web/20070629093808/http:/typophile.com/node/17883 "Go to previous forum topic") [Creating a common suitcase ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070629093808/http:/typophile.com/node/20757 "Go to next forum topic")
author: idoru creactive

comments.content: Try to Google ” Impact CE, Cyr, Greek, Baltic, Tur “

You may find solutions for your problems at  
 [http://fontservice.typo.cz/](http://web.archive.org/web/20070629093808/http:/fontservice.typo.cz/ "http://fontservice.typo.cz/")
